cyclone.name: IAN
cyclone.current_location: about 615 mi ESE of Kingston, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: Moving WNW across the central Caribbean and forecast to turn NW, cross western Cuba, then head toward the Florida peninsula early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southwest-to-west-central Florida coast (near/just north of the Tampa Bay area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect as of Advisory 1
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect as of Advisory 1
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Jamaica, Cayman Islands, western Cuba, all of the Florida peninsula and adjacent Atlantic and Gulf coasts
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34–50 kt) could reach the Fort Lauderdale/Port Everglades area late Tuesday night into Wednesday as the system crosses Florida.
weather_observation.storm_surge: If the center tracks west of the port, onshore winds could push a minor surge of 1–3 ft along the southeast Florida coast; higher values would remain on the Gulf side.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands may bring heavy downpours with event totals of 2–4 inches, locally higher, during Tuesday–Wednesday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents beginning early next week; isolated tornadoes possible in rainbands as the cyclone nears.
